inclusion.criterion: severe degenerative aortic valve stenosis (echocardiographic criteria: AV effective orifice area (EOA) of < 1 cm2, mean AV gradient of > 40 mmHg, or AV peak systolic velocity of > 4.0 m/s)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: TTE revealed severe aortic stenosis with worsening LV function. EF was 25%. RV pressure was 41 and had biatrial enlargement.

inclusion.criterion: symptomatic from the aortic valve stenosis (dyspnoea in NYHA-class II or greater, angina pectoris, or syncope)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: He presented to his cardiologist on [**2148-10-1**] with progressive SOB and LE edema.

inclusion.criterion: technical and anatomical eligible for both interventions (as specified by Medtronic CoreValve(TM) for the TAVI procedure) after a formal consult by a cardiologist and a cardiovascular surgeon
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: expected to survive more than one year after the intervention
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient underwent a preop workup for valvular replacement with preop chest CT scan and carotid US (showing moderate heterogeneous plaque with bilateral 1-39% ICA stenosis).

inclusion.criterion: able to provide written informed consent as approved by the regional ethical committee after having received adequate information about the study
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: other significant valve disease, coronary artery disease requiring revascularisation at the time of referral
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: The patient underwent a cardiac cath with right heart cath to evaluate his pulm art pressures which showed no angiographically apparent flow-limiting coronary artery disease.

exclusion.criterion: myocardial infarction or percutaneous coronary intervention within the last year
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: The cardiac cath with right heart cath to evaluate his pulm art pressures which showed no angiographically apparent flow-limiting coronary artery disease.

exclusion.criterion: stroke or TIA within the last 30 days
exclusion.label: unknown
does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: The patient underwent a preop workup for valvular replacement with preop chest CT scan and carotid US (showing moderate heterogeneous plaque with bilateral 1-39% ICA stenosis).

exclusion.criterion: pulmonary insufficiency (FEV1 or diffusion capacity < 40% of expected)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient's age and symptoms suggest eligibility, but the formal consult by a cardiologist and a cardiovascular surgeon is unknown. Additionally, the patient's ability to provide written informed consent is also unknown.
